column4: is there any way to detect devices connected to the parallel port?
or even a way to detect if my parallel port is supported?
isn't fat 32 known for it's instability?
frankly, i'm not even sure if my kernel supports it....
patience. Some of us multitask. type lsmod and see if parport and lp modules are there.
what device are you trying to connect?
an artec scanner that is supposed to be supported by Xsane
I don't think it will autodetect magically like USB
you could always try a parallel printer to make sure the ports working (though it's unlikely that it isn't)
any idea where to search for some help? perhaps a clever search string for google?
and make sure your parport is set to ECP mode - you gotta do this in the BIOS
hmm.... I'll give that a shot, thanks , be back shortly perhaps...
